page.title: 10 HARNAGE GRANGE
page.content: Harnage Grange is a very large working farm owned by Mr.Scott. Monks associated with Buildwas Abbey originally had the farm. Now the farm involves work with both crops and animals. The main animals kept are sheep, cows, pheasants and bees. Pheasants are bred for food and for sport, this being one of Mr. Scott's hobbies. Rings are kept on the bird's beaks in order to prevent them from pecking out their feathers. Electric lamps are used to keep the chicks warm. Two varieties of honey from bees fed entirely on rape seed flowers. This honey solidifies rapidly if not collected at the earliest opportunity. The rape honey was tasted and found to be very palatable.
